TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit UserPermissionCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public MustInherit Class UserPermissionCollection Implements IEnumerable
public ref class UserPermissionCollection abstract : System::Collections::IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents the collection of objects associated with the current form.

remarks.para: Each UserPermission object in the UserPermissionCollection is used to associate a specific set of rights with an individual user of a form template. The property returns the number of UserPermission objects in the collection, and the , and methods can be used to manipulate the members of the collection.

Docs.param: The e-mail address in the format user@domain.com of the user to whom permissions on the current form are being granted.
Docs.summary: Adds a new user to the current form.
Docs.returns: A object that represents the specified user.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the UserPermissionsCollection for the current form, and then adds a new user.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) Me.Permission.UserPermissions.Add("someone@example.com") End Sub

Docs.exception: The parameter passed to this method is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The parameter passed to this method is not valid. For example, it is of the wrong type or format.
The form template is not configured for Full Trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box.

Docs.param: The e-mail address in the format user@domain.com of the user to whom permissions on the current form are being granted.
The permissions on the current form that are being granted to the specified user as a combination of one or more values.
Docs.summary: Adds a new user with the specified permissions.
Docs.returns: A .object that represents the specified user.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the UserPermissionsCollection for the current form, and then adds and assigns a user to the Full Control access level.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) Me.Permission.UserPermissions.Add("someone@example.com", _ PermissionType.FullControl) End Sub

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.UserPermission Add (string userId, DateTime expirationDate);

abstract member Add : string * DateTime -> Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.UserPermission

Docs.param: The e-mail address in the format user@domain.com of the user to whom permissions on the current form are being granted.
The expiration date for the permissions that are being granted as a System.DateTime value.
Docs.summary: Add a new user to the current form with an expiration date.
Docs.returns: A object that represents the specified user.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the UserPermissionsCollection for the current form, adds a new user to the current form, and sets an expiration date of two days from the current date.
example.code:
Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) Dim strExpirationDate As String = _ DateTime.Today.AddDays(2).ToString() dtExpirationDate As DateTime = DateTime.Parse(strExpirationDate)
Me.Permission.UserPermissions.Add("someone@example.com", _ dtExpirationDate) End Sub

Docs.exception: The parameter passed to this method is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The parameter passed to this method is not valid. For example, it is of the wrong type or format.
The form template is not configured for Full Trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box.

Docs.param: The e-mail address in the format user@domain.com of the user to whom permissions on the current form are being granted.
The permissions on the current form that are being granted to the specified user as a combination of one or more values.
The expiration date for the permissions that are being granted as a System.DateTime value.
Docs.summary: Creates a new set of permissions on the current form for the specified user with the specified permissions and an expiration date.
Docs.returns: A that represents the specified user.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the UserPermissionsCollection for the current form, adds and assigns a user to the Full Control access level, and sets an expiration date of two days from the current date.
example.code:
Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) Dim strExpirationDate As String = _ DateTime.Today.AddDays(2).ToString() dtExpirationDate As DateTime = DateTime.Parse(strExpirationDate)
Me.Permission.UserPermissions.Add("someone@example.com", _ PermissionType.FullControl, dtExpirationDate) End Sub

Docs.exception: The DateTime value provided is invalid.

.property instance int32 Count
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: abstract property int Count { int get(); };
member this.Count : int

Docs.summary: Gets the number of objects in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of objects in the collection.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the UserPermissionsCollection for the current form and displays the count of users.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) MessageBox.Show(Me.Permission.UserPermissions.Count.ToString()) End Sub

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the UserPermission object to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets the object at the specified index in the collection.
Docs.value: A object that represents the specified user.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the UserPermissionsCollection for the current form and sets the second user in the collection to the Change access level.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) Permission.UserPermissions(1).Permission = PermissionType.Change End Sub

Docs.param: The e-mail address of the specified user.
Docs.summary: Get the object with the specified from the collection.
Docs.value: A that represents the specified user. Returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the specified does not exist.

remarks.para: This member can be accessed only by forms running in the same domain as the currently open form, or by forms that have been granted cross-domain permissions.
This type or member can be accessed only from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler.

example.para: In the following example, clicking the Button control gets the UserPermissionsCollection for the current form and sets the user with the e-mail address someone@example.com to the Change access level.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL1_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) Permission.UserPermissions("someone@example.com").Permission = _ PermissionType.Change End Sub
